prompt.input: write a 1-2 funny lines about mango

sampled.completion:
1. - Why did the mango become so popular? Because it's a-peeling!
- If life gives you lemons, a mango can always add some sweetness.
2. 1) Why did the mango go to the doctor? Because it wasn't peeling well!
2) I threw a party and invited all my favorite mangoes, but none of them came - that's what happens when you have a pitto mango-ty!
3. 1) "I once tried to eat a mango with a fork - it was a mistake that only led to laughter and a very sticky table."
2) "Mangoes are the only things that make me regret my inability to roll"
4. Mango, the master of disguise - it transforms from a boring piece of fruit to a fun-sized dessert in your mouth! 
Why did Mango go to the gym? It wanted to get zesty-fied!

sampled:
All four texts contain puns and jokes about mangoes, but they differ in their structure and content. Text 1 and text 4 both use humor to promote mangoes and emphasize their desirability, whereas text 2 deploys wordplay to tease and mock mangoes (as well as the person hosting the party). Text 3 contains personal anecdotes and reflections on the experience of eating mangoes. In terms of tone, text 1 comes across as upbeat and positive, text 2 as sarcastic and irreverent, text 3 as reflective and personal, and text 4 as playful and lighthearted. Overall, the four texts exhibit some diversity in their style, tone, and content, and collectively they offer a range of perspectives on the topic of mangoes.

Yes.

prompt.input: write a 1-2 funny lines about pineapple

sampled.completion:
1. 1. There's a reason why pineapple is called the 'king of fruits' - it doesn't want to be left out of any fruit salads.
2. If you're feeling fancy, top your pizza with pineapple. If you're feeling extravagant, top your pizza with pineapple and extra pineapple.
2. 1. What do you call a pineapple that's always on time? A punctual pineapple.
2. I once had a job as a pineapple stylist. I’d just arrange them on top of hats.
3. 1. Why don't scientists trust pineapples? Because they always tend to be a bit slippery!
2. Pineapple is proof that sometimes the best things in life come in a weird and unassuming package.
4. 1. Why don't surfers ever eat pineapple? Because they already have a pina-colada-da-da-dum.

2. Why don't scientists trust pineapples? Because they contain a lot of fibs!

Text 3 uses a pun to joke about pineapples being slippery, and Text 4 makes a joke about surfers and pineapples. The final text (2) also uses a pun but focuses on the fibrous texture of pineapples. 

Yes
